>unexpected exceptions? Seems much cleaner to just let them propagate
>and let JUnit take care of reporting the failure.

declaring methods with "throws Exception" (or including everything in
the throws clauses of every method called by a method). It's heinous in
real code, but might be OK in Test implementations. I'll have to
consider changing.
